column4: Why doesn't Ubuntu want to rely on mono? What's so bad about it?
it was mostly unnecessary and took a relevant part of the default CD size.
Really? I mean, I keep finding packages that depend on it.
then whenever you install those packages, you'll install Mono.
Tasque and Pinta depend on it.

Once Banshee was replaced by Rhythmbox, only Tetravex (I think that's the name), which is a game, depended on it. They needed more space on the CD so they removed both from the default install, upset.
I'm just wondering if I'm necessarily installing some insidious bloatwhere.
there's some strong criticism towards Mono.
Yes, but what is it? Where can I find it?
I'd like to understand the issue more fully
it's not yet working with GTK+3. It's based on Microsoft .NET. Some developers claim it's resource-heavy and bloated.
Only some claim it's heavy? What, like they can't do benchmarks?
I don't see how benchmarking would help
To show what effect mono-based programs have on resource usage?
nobody is gonna write something in two different languages to compare the implementation. It's mostly a matter of opinion.
I just don't understand how a performance issue could be immeasurable.
